speaker: Sun Plaza
lines: Stalls stand like teeth around a smile the city forgot how to wear.
Coins lie where fingers taught them to wait. Some still wait.
A fountain holds rainwater and swallows wishes without malice.
Pigeons argue history on a statue's shoulder.
Civic pride peeks out from under dust and decides to go back in.
Footsteps approach from a street that does not reach this square anymore.
A gate of bronze ribs blocks a path inward. It remembers what it keeps out.
An oath hums here that nobody living can recite correctly.
A shadow gathers at the gate to make sure.

choices.text: Attempt the oath and pass the gate.
Pay the gate with your token.
Search the stalls for a token of passage.
